title: 114_hr1953
content: The Act titled "No Exemption for Washington from Obamacare Act" mandates health insurance coverage for certain congressional staff and members of the executive branch. Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include members of congress, congressional staff, and political appointees in the health insurance exchange. In section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, political appointees are defined as individuals employed in specific positions within the Executive Schedule of the United States Code. The curr_chunk defines political appointees as limited term, limited emergency, or noncareer appointees in the Senior Executive Service, or those in confidential or policy-determining positions in the executive branch of the Government. The curr_chunk adds restrictions on government contributions for certain individuals under section 8906 of title 5, United States Code, including Members of Congress, congressional staff members, the President, the Vice President, and political appointees. The curr_chunk limits tax credits and cost-sharing for individuals enrolling in health insurance coverage. Members of Congress are restricted from having discretion in staff designations. The curr_chunk clarifies that Members of Congress cannot determine which employees are eligible for coverage through an Exchange. The terms small employer and qualified employers do not include Congress for enrollments in an Exchange and a SHOP Exchange.
